title: headingnorth
author: headingnorth
created_time: October 25, 2024, 09:30:00 AMLast edit: October 25, 2024, 09:48:27 AM by headingnorth
content: I will buy shares of Microsoft so I can vote yes to the bitcoin proposal. I suggest every bitcoiner do the same if possible and even better if you already own shares of the company. One share of common stock is equal to one vote so you don't have to own a lot of shares to be elgible to vote but I don't know how long you have to be a shareholder if the vote is being held in less than two months on December 10.Microsoft Board Asks Shareholders to Vote Against Investing in Bitcoin: SEC Filinghttps://decrypt.co/288185/microsoft-asks-shareholders-vote-against-investing-bitcoin-sec-filing?amp=1I think the chances of approval are not very high but you never know. Of course it would be beyond massive for bitcoin if they voted yes.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: I wonder if we can expect that the shareholders could decide positively if the board calls them in advance to do the opposite? It is one of those ways of "democracy" that gives you the illusion that you have the right to vote, while at the same time that vote means absolutely nothing. However, when viewed individually, the largest shareholders are companies such as Vanguard Group and Blackrock, which together own about 16% of the shares.Maybe these companies will have a strong voice in the decision, and maybe even small shareholders will realize that Bitcoin can bring them profit. Should the decision be positive, it would definitely affect the price of BTC, because people would take it as a really big deal.

comments.author: john_egbert
comments.body: Agreed with Lucius here, no matter what, it's great that you did what you did, and even if it wouldn't matter that much, you did your part, and that's great  Hopefully, it will affect the results and the market afterward in a positive way.

comments.author: Kevystia
comments.body: I think buying shares to support the Bitcoin proposal is a solid move, even if the board is against it. A 'yes' vote could really make a big difference for Bitcoin! Every vote counts, so it's important to own shares before December 10. If enough of us rally together, we could really make an impact.What do you think could happen to Microsoft and Bitcoin if the vote ends up being a 'yes' for the investment, especially given what the board thinks right now?

Should the decision be positive, it would definitely affect the price of BTC, because people would take it as a really big deal.Big share holders in Microsoft Board Members have biggest powerful voices in any vote, and if they don't want to invest in Bitcoin, they will vote against (veto) this idea. Small share holders can raise their voices through votes that mean nothing to decide the company decision to invest in Bitcoin.If Microsoft or any Big Tech invests money in Bitcoin, it will be great news for Bitcoin community as it shows Bitcoin adoption again shifts upward more considerably. Nevertheless, they will consider it as a risky investment and will assign very small part of company treasury for this investment. I don't expect many companies from Big Tech will copy MicroStrategy to use company treasury for Bitcoin investment, raise fund for investment, and borrow money for investment in Bitcoin.If small shareholders are not happy with this vote result, they can sell their shares and use money to invest in Bitcoin individually.

comments.author: Ambatman
comments.body: Why does it seem like we voting for the survival of Bitcoin. With or without Microsoft adoption, Bitcoin still remains. It isn't a priority but it's not a bad thing if it's voted yes.When have the public votes really mattered, they are all just formalities The main decisions are taking place behind the scene.

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: 73% of Microsoft stock is held by large institutional investors:https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/MSFT/holders/Vanguard between their Mutual Funds and regular holdings control over 16%You can buy and vote anyway you want, it's not going to matter.Also, it may or may not go against their corporate charter. It's a bit vague over what they can hold in lieu of cash. But that is was lawyers were invented for, they can figure that out.-Dave

comments.author: Questat
comments.body: Bitcoin is an asset for MicroStrategy companies but probably not for Microsoft. That's because they worry too much about its nature of volatility which could be considered as a threat to their operational liquidity. So it's not surprising that the Microsoft boards are even convincing the shareholders to vote against bitcoin, which we can't guarantee also that all the shareholders will follow. Just like Michael Saylor from MicroStrategy, bitcoin is an asset that could hedge inflation, and I think that some of the Microsoft shareholders will definitely agree on it and see bitcoin as a worthy investment. So there's still chances for bitcoin to win in the voting soon.

comments.author: fuguebtc
comments.body: It would be naive to think that we could influence Microsoft's decisions and even if given the opportunity , I would not participate because it would not benefit me.  Microsoft is planning to invest in bitcoin, which means they are thinking about their own interests and not bitcoin's interests or any of our interests, so why should we waste our time supporting them?To be fair ,  it would be great if a big corporation like Microsoft invested in bitcoin but everything is fine without them ,  bitcoin has been growing without the support of any corporation including Microsoft for the past 15 years .  Or rather , bitcoin doesn't need them, they need bitcoin if they don't want to become obsolete . If they don't get in now, they will miss out on more opportunities because sooner or later they will invest in bitcoin . After all , bitcoin is inevitable.

comments.author: Segmadis
comments.body: It was said, but personaly I don't see how much Bitcoin can benefit from such investment. Now, if they decide to start building their own ecosystem on top of Bitcoin's one it will be a major one which will be much more helpfull for Bitcoin. I really think that someday this will become reality, but till then I am sure that we still have very much in front of us.

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: Nooooo! No more institutional investors please! Bitcoin doesn't need institutional investors anymore. I really don't want deep-pocket companies to get into Bitcoin and control a large supply of it. When everything is controlled by big companies and politicians, let Bitcoin stay as a common mans' currency system. Unfortunately I can't buy Microsoft share in my country directly. Otherwise I would have voted for No.

Without involvement of these big players bitcoin remains little more than play money or Monopoly money, a fringe asset.For bitcoin to be more useful and widely accepted the big players will have to get involved. And their involvement is inevitable, for better or worse. Bitcoin was made to be used by literally anyone, and that includes the corporates and institutions.  That is the reality.On the bright side, it seems to me at least when bitcoin becomes adopted by these major players then governments are probably much less likely to try to ban it or cripple it, or tax it out of existence. So that is something positive.
